commit_message:
Deprecate old auth parameters of ironic

The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`,
`admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config
option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Using these parameters will log a warning.
Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name `and
`auth_url` instead.

Change-Id: I931aff12a20b31308ee26534138c8e99db6eb0c8

subject: Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 00:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['tests/run_functests.sh'], 'message': 'Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests

We're getting double time-stamps in the console log of upstream jobs.
Move the logging of a prefix datestamp into a "-t" option to retain
the status quo prior to Id9ea5131f0026c292ca6453ba2c80fe12c47f808 (we
could, of course, do it the other way and turn if off in the jobs, but
since we didn't have it before...)

While poking, make the time-stamp consistent and always prefixed if -t
is turned on.

Also, it seems the parallel options got a bit of sync with what got
merged.  Add "-j" documentation and remove unused "p" option.

Change-Id: Ic7c2ebeca3f9d5784cac59505b6e6181151f5805
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log datestamp by default in functional tests

We're getting double time-stamps in the console log of upstream jobs.
Move the logging of a prefix datestamp into a "-t" option to retain
the status quo prior to Id9ea5131f0026c292ca6453ba2c80fe12c47f808 (we
could, of course, do it the other way and turn if off in the jobs, but
since we didn't have it before...)

While poking, make the time-stamp consistent and always prefixed if -t
is turned on.

Also, it seems the parallel options got a bit of sync with what got
merged.  Add "-j" documentation and remove unused "p" option.

Change-Id: Ic7c2ebeca3f9d5784cac59505b6e6181151f5805

subject: Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 02:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['bin/dib-run-parts'], 'message': 'Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files

Sourcing of environment files is a bit different than running scripts,
because they are imported into the current environment.  That means
that if they are fiddling with "set -x" you can get odd things in the
output -- for example, if one environment file enables tracing then
all proceeding sourcing will have it on, but all the files sourced
before will not have output.  This is super confusing.

It's also very helpful to see how things are being expanded as they
set environment variables.

Thus I think the best idea is for environment files to leave tracing
alone and dib-run-parts can a) give a useful output about what file it
is sourcing and b) enable tracing around the import, then restore it
to the previous state afterwards.

Change-Id: I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0
'}]
commit_message:
Show tracing around sourcing environment.d files

Sourcing of environment files is a bit different than running scripts,
because they are imported into the current environment.  That means
that if they are fiddling with "set -x" you can get odd things in the
output -- for example, if one environment file enables tracing then
all proceeding sourcing will have it on, but all the files sourced
before will not have output.  This is super confusing.

It's also very helpful to see how things are being expanded as they
set environment variables.

Thus I think the best idea is for environment files to leave tracing
alone and dib-run-parts can a) give a useful output about what file it
is sourcing and b) enable tracing around the import, then restore it
to the previous state afterwards.

Change-Id: I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 03:00:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/developing_elements.rst', 'bin/dib-lint', 'elements/centos/environment.d/00-bootloader.bash', 'elements/manifests/environment.d/14-manifests'], 'message': "Don't set tracing in environment files

Because environment files are sourced into the current environment,
they shouldn't be setting global settings like tracing else they
affect every preceeding import.  This is quite confusing when only
half your imports are traced in the logs, because it was either turned
on, or off, by a preceeding environment import.

There is a corresponding dib-run-parts change in
I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0 that will greatly increase
debugability for environment files by deliberately logging what files
are sourced and consistently turning on tracing around their import.

This isn't strictly necessary (since dib-run-parts with the prior
change will just turn tracing off after import anyway) but it's a
decent cleanup for consistency.  A bare-minimum dib-lint check is
added.  Documentation is updated.

Change-Id: I10f68be0642835a04af7e5a2bc101502f61e5357
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set tracing in environment files

Because environment files are sourced into the current environment,
they shouldn't be setting global settings like tracing else they
affect every preceeding import.  This is quite confusing when only
half your imports are traced in the logs, because it was either turned
on, or off, by a preceeding environment import.

There is a corresponding dib-run-parts change in
I29f7df1514aeb988222d1094e8269eddb485c2a0 that will greatly increase
debugability for environment files by deliberately logging what files
are sourced and consistently turning on tracing around their import.

This isn't strictly necessary (since dib-run-parts with the prior
change will just turn tracing off after import anyway) but it's a
decent cleanup for consistency.  A bare-minimum dib-lint check is
added.  Documentation is updated.

Change-Id: I10f68be0642835a04af7e5a2bc101502f61e5357

subject: Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22776, 'name': 'Nakul Dahiwade', 'email': 'nakul.dahiwade@intel.com', 'username': 'nakul.dahiwade'}, {'_account_id': 23317, 'name': 'ShangXiao', 'email': 'shangxiaobj@inspur.com', 'username': 'ShangXiao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 10:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': "Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM
backend was missing from the pluggable version, causing router
interfaces to be created with a '::1' IP (equal to the gateway on
PD subnets). The resulting command:

ip netns exec <router_namespace> ip -6 addr add ::1/64

would then fail. This patch restores the check to ensure that
'::1' is not used for router interface ports, and introduces a
test to protect against future regressions.

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e
Closes-Bug: 1631693
(cherry picked from commit 14ffea4444985eb041181d1bdef9af53ccb4d9f9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM
backend was missing from the pluggable version, causing router
interfaces to be created with a '::1' IP (equal to the gateway on
PD subnets). The resulting command:

ip netns exec <router_namespace> ip -6 addr add ::1/64

would then fail. This patch restores the check to ensure that
'::1' is not used for router interface ports, and introduces a
test to protect against future regressions.

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e
Closes-Bug: 1631693
(cherry picked from commit 14ffea4444985eb041181d1bdef9af53ccb4d9f9)

commit_message:
Pecan: Don't prefetch resource fields on DELETE

The legacy wsgi does not prefetch resources and specify fields on
DELETE.  It does do this on PUTs though.  However, the pecan wsgi policy
hook was doing it for both PUT and DELETE.  This also fixes a failure
with the auto-allocated-topology tests.

Change-Id: I9933c141f7d0481caade5a9484022fe090cf47f0
Closes-Bug: #1633664

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I598eba9f7ca4ffef4ebf4354394e33af5a4b6dbd

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom

for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I0f9359aa2b2827aab28396a6e07e995754cb4f49

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-26 13:40:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'keystone/identity/mapping_backends/base.py', 'keystone/identity/mapping_backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_id_mapping_sql.py', 'releasenotes/notes/domain_mapping_list-a368ac5a252ec84f.yaml', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': 'Faster id mapping lookup

id_mapping_api was designed to make a query per entity to fetch
public ids. This lead to a very poor performance when there were many
entries in LDAP. For example, for 15k entries 15k MySQL queries were
required. For the first run 15k INSERTs were required, which makes
things even worse.

Change this behavior to fetch related mappings from MySQL as a list and
perform the necessary join in-memory.

bp ldap-preprocessing
Partial-Bug: 1582585
Change-Id: I2c266e91f2f05be760f8a3eea3738868243cc9c6
'}]
commit_message:
Faster id mapping lookup

id_mapping_api was designed to make a query per entity to fetch
public ids. This lead to a very poor performance when there were many
entries in LDAP. For example, for 15k entries 15k MySQL queries were
required. For the first run 15k INSERTs were required, which makes
things even worse.

Change this behavior to fetch related mappings from MySQL as a list and
perform the necessary join in-memory.

bp ldap-preprocessing
Partial-Bug: 1582585
Change-Id: I2c266e91f2f05be760f8a3eea3738868243cc9c6

commit_message:
Suppress unexpected file warnings for rsync temp files

Do not log unexpected file warning for rsync temp files when the parsing
of the timespamp fails.  If the file passes a regex test suppress the
logger waring, but still return it as an unexpected file from
get_ondisk_files.

Closes-Bug: 1616504

Change-Id: I5a5d6e24710e4880776b32edcbc07021acf77676

In Iedad1e0871388965acefb806369dc32b6c85cbd9 we merged the Murano

commit_message:
Add replacepkgs to the manual ovs upgrade workaround and fix a typo

rpm command will return an exit 1 if ovs package is already
there and will exit the step_1.sh script. To get around this
force the update with --replacepkgs

Also remove the \ just before the $ which cause a syntax
error for the ceph storage

Change-Id: I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9
Closes-bug: 1636748

subject: Provide the app developer with a tool to validate their app
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-19 04:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/user-validation-tool.rst', 'specs/newton/approved/rework_exceptions.rst'], 'message': 'Provide the app developer with a tool to validate their app

As an Application Developer I want to be able to validate my workflows for
common syntax errors and typos (invalid yaml file, invalid muranopl
statements, etc.) I also want to be able to validate my whole application
package structure for common packaging errors (zipped with no -r, classes
mentioned in manifest, but not provided, etc.) in order to develop
applications faster, resolve issues with my application efficiently and
provide better support for my applications.

defines blueprint user-validation-tool

Change-Id: I7feba68924d38cdadbf45d89fdd9ec3fc44c781b
'}]
commit_message:
Provide the app developer with a tool to validate their app

As an Application Developer I want to be able to validate my workflows for
common syntax errors and typos (invalid yaml file, invalid muranopl
statements, etc.) I also want to be able to validate my whole application
package structure for common packaging errors (zipped with no -r, classes
mentioned in manifest, but not provided, etc.) in order to develop
applications faster, resolve issues with my application efficiently and
provide better support for my applications.

defines blueprint user-validation-tool

Change-Id: I7feba68924d38cdadbf45d89fdd9ec3fc44c781b

commit_message:
update required packages for opstools support

the packages required for opstools support (fluentd, sensu, and
related) were duplicated across all the overcloud elements.

this consolidates the opstools packages into a single
overcloud-opstools element and makes it a dependency of the
overcloud-* elements.  It also adds the missing fluentd secure-forward
plugin package.

Change-Id: I4df1bb0c4fdc3211ef32aaa112d1c46063c85309
(cherry picked from commit 82ccb486c19022eefc26a65647977345ce0f274f)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 21:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['docker/openstack-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/kolla-toolbox/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/barbican/templates/barbican.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Remove PythonMySQL packages

 * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Kolla currently uses PyMySQL for all connections bar Barbican (which works fine

Change-Id: Ibb7661bf98ff0f66e3c9e65f0746db56eb4e7f14

fix missed kolla-toolbox dockerfile

Change-Id: If32ae93c945091d1228b16529c2ba06431789ab5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove PythonMySQL packages

PyMySQL is prefered to PythonMySQL for Sqlalchemy, as it provides
python3 support and is actively maintained, and is therefore the
currently recommended lib for db connections.
 * http://docs.openstack.org/newton/install-guide-rdo/environment-sql-database.html
 * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Kolla currently uses PyMySQL for all connections bar Barbican (which works fine
with PyMySQL), so this commit should have minimal impact outside of removing some
unrequired deps.

Change-Id: Ibb7661bf98ff0f66e3c9e65f0746db56eb4e7f14

fix missed kolla-toolbox dockerfile

Change-Id: If32ae93c945091d1228b16529c2ba06431789ab5

commit_message:
Straighten driver.cleanup & destroy interfaces

Currently cleanup interface has implicit flags destroy_disks and
destroy_vifs, and explicit flag 'delete instance service files', which
is calculated inside cleanup method using passed migrate_data parameter.

It does not look consistency and does not allow us to handle the files
deletion outside of migration flow, where migrate_data is not accesible.

This patch introduces straightforward delete_files flag into both
cleanup and destroy interfaces instead of migrate_data parameter.

Related-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: I6a4b953d0cf652fd5926da47e71dae7688a9b8eb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-12 16:18:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup instance directory on revert resize

Currently revert resize operation does not delete instance directory on
target host in case of shared block storage usage. The reason is that
the code does not distinguish between shared block storage and shared
instance path, asking to leave instance disks and directory in both
cases. As the result the second attempt to resize the instance to the
same host fails.

With this patch the code figures out both flags separately and uses them
to correct destroy the instance on the host.

The same change is added to _destroy_evacuated_instances method since it
potentially has the same problem.

Closes-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: Icc995f3a7eda386a0a7d0a96b6662a1ab52d5d0e
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup instance directory on revert resize

Currently revert resize operation does not delete instance directory on
target host in case of shared block storage usage. The reason is that
the code does not distinguish between shared block storage and shared
instance path, asking to leave instance disks and directory in both
cases. As the result the second attempt to resize the instance to the
same host fails.

With this patch the code figures out both flags separately and uses them
to correct destroy the instance on the host.

The same change is added to _destroy_evacuated_instances method since it
potentially has the same problem.

Closes-Bug: 1631481
Change-Id: Icc995f3a7eda386a0a7d0a96b6662a1ab52d5d0e

commit_message:
Don't deprecate the LDAP property which is still needed

`user_attribute_ignore` or `group_attribute_ignore` are both needed
by identity ldap backend to judge whether a specific attribute could
be returned for read user or group operations.

Closes-Bug: #1637135
Change-Id: If623e1e4d3c827d00f17203652f33b74ac138d62

subject: Correct the example keystone session code imports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-29 09:43:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/client-api.rst'], 'message': 'Correct the example keystone session code imports

This is a follow up to patch Ia3fd947ff619c11ff0ce474897533dcf7b49d9b3.
One of the imports for the keystone session example was wrong. It was
trying to import v3 like:

  from keystoneauth1 import v3

Whereas in my testing v3 actually exists deeper under identity:

  from keystoneauth1.identity import v3

This patch fixes this import in the example documentation.

Change-Id: Ie31144fe65116d20a36b83a96079a3804bf55f29
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the example keystone session code imports

This is a follow up to patch Ia3fd947ff619c11ff0ce474897533dcf7b49d9b3.
One of the imports for the keystone session example was wrong. It was
trying to import v3 like:

  from keystoneauth1 import v3

Whereas in my testing v3 actually exists deeper under identity:

  from keystoneauth1.identity import v3

This patch fixes this import in the example documentation.

Change-Id: Ie31144fe65116d20a36b83a96079a3804bf55f29

added self.instance to a log message in ConfigDrivePowerVM, but that

commit_message:
Remove self.instance from ConfigDrivePowerVM log

Commit
https://review.openstack.org/#q,I08962ce2757984e709cf51a4ae9ef654b7667d1a,n,z
added self.instance to a log message in ConfigDrivePowerVM, but that
class has no self.instance.  This results in an exception in the normal
code path.

In fixing the above, another anomalous exception/log was found and fixed
in the vif driver.

Change-Id: I12d99f6dcbfb2a283f282c9dff1d4addf4b51254
Closes-Bug: #1637656

commit_message:
Clarifying on the remove of `build_auth_context` middleware

Keystone just remove the check of admin token from
`build_auth_context` middleware, not the middleware itself.

bp removed-as-of-ocata
Change-Id: I9aa7a4dafb7f9a3333832d81923e4f11390dad14

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 03:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': 'Support token_endpoint as an auth_type

For backwards compat with what operators have been trained to do, map
token_endpoint to admin_token for them. This has shown up a few times in
the wild. Most recently:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5250

Change-Id: Ie083381e7fda19e016b6425939bd3c2dc260fa9b
'}]
commit_message:
Support token_endpoint as an auth_type

For backwards compat with what operators have been trained to do, map
token_endpoint to admin_token for them. This has shown up a few times in
the wild. Most recently:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5250

Change-Id: Ie083381e7fda19e016b6425939bd3c2dc260fa9b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 18:19:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/lang-root-marker.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix AFS lang publishing

Liberty uses a specific openstack-doc-tools version that does not tag
the translated documents for the new AFS based docs publishing.

Change-Id: I0a9ef8ed2476d05b70f2cc8c05e28aea7a00705a

commit_message:
Fix AFS lang publishing

Liberty uses a specific openstack-doc-tools version that does not tag
the translated documents for the new AFS based docs publishing.

Add custom script to add the root-marker file to each guide.

Change-Id: I0a9ef8ed2476d05b70f2cc8c05e28aea7a00705a

commit_message:
ceilometer-agent-central has been replaced by ceilometer-polling

The ceilometer-agent-central and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use
ceilometer-polling and call the respective pollsters by
namespace.

Change-Id: I3af6fe9cc9c5b0fcf0406f89f402cbd1a31f66c4
Closes-Bug: 1606787

subject: Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 21517, 'name': 'Shashi', 'email': 'sonawane.shashikant@hpe.com', 'username': 'sonawane.shashikant'}, {'_account_id': 21531, 'name': 'Sumit Girish Shatwara', 'email': 'sumit.shatwara@hpe.com', 'username': 'sumit7990'}, {'_account_id': 21976, 'name': 'Kaminario K2 CI', 'email': 'cinder.devops.CTR@kaminario.com', 'username': 'kaminario'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 03:58:13.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/qos-specs-v2-qos-specs.inc'], 'message': 'Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"

Because of the underlying SQLAlchemy qos-specs functionality, which is
the only in-tree DB implementation, requiring context.is_admin to be
True, it's not technically correct to say "Administrators only,
depending on policy settings."  Even if the associated
volume_extension:qos_specs_manage policy doesn't require an
"administrator", the @requires_admin_context decorator on the
underlying functionality definitely will.

    ERROR: User does not have admin privileges (HTTP 403)

Change-Id: I0bc6a59c612b6c4ff7dcaff36dad712d8e3e03c2
Partial-Bug: #1621715
'}]
commit_message:
Doc: qos-specs is always and only "Administrators only"

Because of the underlying SQLAlchemy qos-specs functionality, which is
the only in-tree DB implementation, requiring context.is_admin to be
True, it's not technically correct to say "Administrators only,
depending on policy settings."  Even if the associated
volume_extension:qos_specs_manage policy doesn't require an
"administrator", the @requires_admin_context decorator on the
underlying functionality definitely will.

    ERROR: User does not have admin privileges (HTTP 403)

Change-Id: I0bc6a59c612b6c4ff7dcaff36dad712d8e3e03c2
Partial-Bug: #1621715

subject: Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 17:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs

The default subnetpool CIDR seems to continue to cause issues with
external network routing in the Ironic Python Agent source jobs, this
patch disables subnetpools for these jobs until the issue is resolved in
devstack.

Change-Id: Ic29d2dcb06f55cea491f9e797405441860aa83f9
'}]
commit_message:
Disable SUBNETPOOLS for Ironic ramdisk source jobs

The default subnetpool CIDR seems to continue to cause issues with
external network routing in the Ironic Python Agent source jobs, this
patch disables subnetpools for these jobs until the issue is resolved in
devstack.

Change-Id: Ic29d2dcb06f55cea491f9e797405441860aa83f9

[{'number': 42, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:15:15.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/Support-backup-import-on-another-Storage-database-53c86a1013a3b8f6.yaml', 'cinder/backup/drivers/posix.py', 'cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py'], 'message': 'Support backup import on another Storage database

Currently a volume backup can only be restored on the same Block
Storage service. This is because restoring a volume from a backup
requires metadata available on the remote database.

This proposal is to store backup metadata together
with the data, so a user will be able to restore a volume backup
on another Block Storage.

Change-Id: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f
Implements: blueprint support-backup-import-on-another-storage-database
'}]
commit_message:
Support backup import on another Storage database

Currently a volume backup can only be restored on the same Block
Storage service. This is because restoring a volume from a backup
requires metadata available on the remote database.

This proposal is to store backup metadata together
with the data, so a user will be able to restore a volume backup
on another Block Storage.

Change-Id: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f
Implements: blueprint support-backup-import-on-another-storage-database

commit_message:
Update db operation of cinder in "extra_specs"

When we config cinder with a few of types, and the non-admin user
may not have the "extra_specs" in the context or db may not retrun
the field. Now, if we want to del the field of "extra_specs",
there is something wrong occur. we could do the update.

Change-Id: I48c73076f30e068a1ee9dc8730eacbd34f30547e

commit_message:
[install] Update unset environment variable step

- Fix the incorrect environment variable.
  'OS_URL' should be 'OS_AUTH_URL'.

- Add another should be unset environment variable.
  And it will not require you input password after running the
  command until you unset the 'OS_PASSWORD'.

Change-Id: Ice02b301e03c06da9fdb26b3bfcb3fd4d8be1fcb
Closes-Bug: #1632992

subject: Document and be more explicit in normalization
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-22 14:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test__utils.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/model.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/data-model-cf50d86982646370.yaml', 'shade/_normalize.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Document and be more explicit in normalization

Put extra keys in both the root resource and in a properties dict.

Ensure data types are correct. Make sure int, float and bool values
are returned as int and bool.

Change disabled in flavor to is_disabled for consistency with other
bools we've added. There has been no release with the addition of disabled,
so changing it now is still safe.

Add locations and direct_url to images. They're optional in glance, but
that's evil.

Let image schema attribute fall through to extra properties.

Add zone to current_location.

Add readable mappings for power_state, task_state, vm_state, launched_at
and terminated_at for Servers. Also add a non-camel-cased host_id.

This is a big patch, but it's mostly just reorganizing and adding docs.
Looking at the changes to the tests and seeing that the only change is
adding zone and properties into a couple of fixtures is a good place to
start.

Change-Id: If5674c049c8dd85ca0b3483b7c2dc82b9e139bd6
"}]
commit_message:
Document and be more explicit in normalization

Put extra keys in both the root resource and in a properties dict.

Ensure data types are correct. Make sure int, float and bool values
are returned as int and bool.

Change disabled in flavor to is_disabled for consistency with other
bools we've added. There has been no release with the addition of disabled,
so changing it now is still safe.

Add locations and direct_url to images. They're optional in glance, but
that's evil.

Let image schema attribute fall through to extra properties.

Add zone to current_location.

Add readable mappings for power_state, task_state, vm_state, launched_at
and terminated_at for Servers. Also add a non-camel-cased host_id.

This is a big patch, but it's mostly just reorganizing and adding docs.
Looking at the changes to the tests and seeing that the only change is
adding zone and properties into a couple of fixtures is a good place to
start.

Change-Id: If5674c049c8dd85ca0b3483b7c2dc82b9e139bd6

subject: Make zuul_swift_upload.py more accurate for mime type detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-10 08:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/zuul_swift_upload.py'], 'message': "Make zuul_swift_upload.py more accurate for mime type detection

When a text file is quite generic like a .css or .js file
libmagic will detect the file's content as text/plain. This
patch adds a check of the mime database in order to guess the
mime type given a file extension. This is only done
if text/plain is detected by libmagic.

Change-Id: Ic73332533fc4d6c1a89ccbdb59d44f3697c56dc0
"}]
commit_message:
Make zuul_swift_upload.py more accurate for mime type detection

When a text file is quite generic like a .css or .js file
libmagic will detect the file's content as text/plain. This
patch adds a check of the mime database in order to guess the
mime type given a file extension. This is only done
if text/plain is detected by libmagic.

Change-Id: Ic73332533fc4d6c1a89ccbdb59d44f3697c56dc0

commit_message:
networking-bgpvpn: add check-requirements jobs

The job was disabled at a time when the project was doing
released delayed with Openstack releases.

It can be re-enabled now.

(This reverts commit b8c4f8abfe5f69924ce804d5ed7a271e8d1fe9b5)

Change-Id: I80a81edee14479ec55bec568dde993e73e2e0dd8

commit_message:
Fix path issue in gate-dib-dsvm-functests

We recently added bindep support to diskimage-builder, in doing so, we

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 05:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I815cc67860d4d858d2f17e273ec27a498e11af2a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I815cc67860d4d858d2f17e273ec27a498e11af2a

In keeping with the other normalize methods, combine these two into a

Removed a unittest that did literally nothing but was mocking out things

Depends-On: I59e9834d249ccda0beeb715a8d6271140fb144f4
Change-Id: I077f9d8c4d250d180dec9ce4aabc8f64b507b05f

commit_message:
Merge nova and neutron normalize methods

In keeping with the other normalize methods, combine these two into a
single normalize method.

Removed a unittest that did literally nothing but was mocking out things
at a crazy level. Remind me that we should REALLY stop mocking out
anything other than the requests calls.

Depends-On: I59e9834d249ccda0beeb715a8d6271140fb144f4
Change-Id: I077f9d8c4d250d180dec9ce4aabc8f64b507b05f

commit_message:
Add structure for Devstack plugin

This review creates the structure for the Devstack plugin and
prints to the console to ensure its execution in the gate.

Follow-up reviews will do more useful stuff like setting up
the environment for our functional testing (ldap, federation).

Change-Id: I820ae355ae8f3183fee2b8207e3c17e8bd10dc17

commit_message:
rename the option scheduler_default_filters

The value of "scheduler_default_filters" is what filters are really
used by users and it is not the default one, which is misleading.

Change-Id: If3bf379c6111e7d0d4f0f49adfa6b0b48c638697
Closes-Bug:#1449934

commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ibe03fcbf2cec154ae51753fb916705b8b5dcad4d
Closes-Bug: 1579718

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-20 09:01:54.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/ambari/deploy.py', 'sahara/plugins/ambari/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix Ranger init in HDP 2.2

The Ranger init method is moved out of create_blueprint method. The
semantics of create_blueprint does not suppose any other manipulations
other than blueprint call.

This also allows to scale cluster w/o breaking the Ranger installation.

Partially-implements-blueprint: hdp-22-support
Change-Id: Ic3884789afd008709a40d6ead607da2e596e61f9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Ranger init in HDP 2.2

The Ranger init method is moved out of create_blueprint method. The
semantics of create_blueprint does not suppose any other manipulations
other than blueprint call.

This also allows to scale cluster w/o breaking the Ranger installation.

Partially-implements-blueprint: hdp-22-support
Change-Id: Ic3884789afd008709a40d6ead607da2e596e61f9

subject: Make Swift service profile default to rabbitmq_node_ips
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 15:34:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/swift/proxy.pp'], 'message': 'Make Swift service profile default to rabbitmq_node_ips

This is a follow up to change Ie53c93456529420588eb1927703ea91b54095d87.

It fixes an issue where RabbitMQ is used in a three-node HA environment
and restarted by pacemaker. Until now the Swift proxy server would log
errors infinitely, because the ceilometermiddleware tried to reconnect
to the same RabbitMQ node all the time.

Closes-Bug: 1637443
Change-Id: I826ae2b3db8b4021014028c26bd2f6b0faccda39
'}]
commit_message:
Make Swift service profile default to rabbitmq_node_ips

This is a follow up to change Ie53c93456529420588eb1927703ea91b54095d87.

It fixes an issue where RabbitMQ is used in a three-node HA environment
and restarted by pacemaker. Until now the Swift proxy server would log
errors infinitely, because the ceilometermiddleware tried to reconnect
to the same RabbitMQ node all the time.

Closes-Bug: 1637443
Change-Id: I826ae2b3db8b4021014028c26bd2f6b0faccda39

commit_message:
Deprecate rabbit connection params

The rabbit connection parameters have been deprecated in oslo[0] in favor
of transport_url which is provided by oslo::messaging::default.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: Ia78fcca898aea28bfe436faa259544f5594a5af6

subject: Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 11:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/swift-proxy.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering

The Ceilometer middleware is in the wrong place; actually any middleware
should be deployed after catch_errors to catch any errors that would
otherwise crash the proxy service. Additionally the ceilometer
middleware should be deployed after any authentication middleware.

Closes-Bug: 1637471
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I710ff2f51271a78582fa502e7eecfa687800c664
(cherry picked from commit 38fe61be95a0efbce32202f708f5bf2b1fe5b8e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering

The Ceilometer middleware is in the wrong place; actually any middleware
should be deployed after catch_errors to catch any errors that would
otherwise crash the proxy service. Additionally the ceilometer
middleware should be deployed after any authentication middleware.

Closes-Bug: 1637471
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I710ff2f51271a78582fa502e7eecfa687800c664
(cherry picked from commit 38fe61be95a0efbce32202f708f5bf2b1fe5b8e4)

commit_message:
RBD Thin Provisioning stats

Allow the RBD driver to work with max_over_subscription_ratio.

This should be expanded to use rbd diff_iterate2() when
Infernalis and newer deployments are widespread.

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: Ida7654545ae46d106908b991c91bab989b998484

subject: Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 05:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_aggregates_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_availability_zone.py'], 'message': 'Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if
no additional error message is specified.
This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

Change-Id: Ia31238077b70f864bdc6c61839eaed2ac74b3ce2
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if
no additional error message is specified.
This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

Change-Id: Ia31238077b70f864bdc6c61839eaed2ac74b3ce2

subject: Logging: avoid string interpolation when not needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 10:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py', 'shade/operatorcloud.py', 'shade/meta.py', 'shade/task_manager.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Logging: avoid string interpolation when not needed

Call to `format` or '%' (basically all string formating) can be
expensive and if someone is not interested in the logs produced
by shade (log_level set to error or higher) can be avoided.

Note: this change is a bit risky given the low unit test coverage.
But the longer we wait the harder this change will be.

Change-Id: I171f4ee08e5978c7b6e3853ed4ee533682c2ffe6
"}]
commit_message:
Logging: avoid string interpolation when not needed

Call to `format` or '%' (basically all string formating) can be
expensive and if someone is not interested in the logs produced
by shade (log_level set to error or higher) can be avoided.

Note: this change is a bit risky given the low unit test coverage.
But the longer we wait the harder this change will be.

Change-Id: I171f4ee08e5978c7b6e3853ed4ee533682c2ffe6

subject: Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-31 12:09:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA

In some cases, for instance, when updating from a non-SSL setup in
HAProxy to an SSL setup, we don't reload haproxy's configuration.
This is problematic since we need HAProxy to serve the certificates
and the new endpoints.

This forces the reload when puppet notices changes.

Change-Id: Ie1dd809e6beef33fadad48de55e488219fb7d686
Closes-Bug: #1636921
(cherry picked from commit c01acb0c4930ecbef7de1ed876afa6120fe2ee35)
"}]
commit_message:
Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA

In some cases, for instance, when updating from a non-SSL setup in
HAProxy to an SSL setup, we don't reload haproxy's configuration.
This is problematic since we need HAProxy to serve the certificates
and the new endpoints.

This forces the reload when puppet notices changes.

Change-Id: Ie1dd809e6beef33fadad48de55e488219fb7d686
Closes-Bug: #1636921
(cherry picked from commit c01acb0c4930ecbef7de1ed876afa6120fe2ee35)

After some failed overcloud deployments the ctlplane address does not
exists, making the inventory generation fail.

commit_message:
Remove libvirt migration flags options

The 'live_migration_flag' and 'block_migration_flag' options in libvirt
section that were deprecated in Mitaka have been completely removed in
Newton, because nova automatically sets correct migration flags.

Change-Id: Ia4bbbe3d0e46467b0d5f0a495528471dbf340b01

subject: Install qemu-efi on AArch64 hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 11:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_compute_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_utils.py'], 'message': "Install qemu-efi on AArch64 hosts

UEFI firmware is required to chain into the bootloader supplied by AArch64
cloud images. Ubuntu's qemu-efi package supplies Tianocore-based UEFI
firmware for AArch64 QEMU guests. Install it by default.

Closes-Bug: #1637615

Change-Id: Ie2477a42ed7a850c2d84ddf2e3e17c264d507374
(cherry picked from commit f243da25fe51012644a89b7a5caba9dde971685b)
"}]
commit_message:
Install qemu-efi on AArch64 hosts

UEFI firmware is required to chain into the bootloader supplied by AArch64
cloud images. Ubuntu's qemu-efi package supplies Tianocore-based UEFI
firmware for AArch64 QEMU guests. Install it by default.

Closes-Bug: #1637615

Change-Id: Ie2477a42ed7a850c2d84ddf2e3e17c264d507374
(cherry picked from commit f243da25fe51012644a89b7a5caba9dde971685b)

subject: Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 20:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml'], 'message': 'Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
'}]
commit_message:
Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b

subject: Add workaround for functions in translation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 13:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_translation_rule.py', 'heat/engine/translation.py'], 'message': "Add workaround for functions in translation

Currently if translation data is function and translation path
runs over unresolved function's value (i.e. intermediate data is
function), translation works incorrectly and raises AttributeError.
This workaround makes translation skip rules, where translation values
contains inside functions.

NOTE: This patch is not solve issues, described by Zane Bitter in [1],
just add workaround for current mechanism. Also, it doesn't affect
destination values, just intermediate, which currently cannot be safely
resolved.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1620859

Change-Id: I5d7f8d3a615590325d38702b21f224ff3de33315
Closes-bug: #1630214
(cherry picked from commit 6396d7c617431309dc5bd463baecbfc4dcfe4772)
"}]
commit_message:
Add workaround for functions in translation

Currently if translation data is function and translation path
runs over unresolved function's value (i.e. intermediate data is
function), translation works incorrectly and raises AttributeError.
This workaround makes translation skip rules, where translation values
contains inside functions.

NOTE: This patch is not solve issues, described by Zane Bitter in [1],
just add workaround for current mechanism. Also, it doesn't affect
destination values, just intermediate, which currently cannot be safely
resolved.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1620859

Change-Id: I5d7f8d3a615590325d38702b21f224ff3de33315
Closes-bug: #1630214
(cherry picked from commit 6396d7c617431309dc5bd463baecbfc4dcfe4772)

commit_message:
Fix handling of unavailable OSTF

Backbone mixins listen to ostf object properties on Healtcheck tab
(tests, testruns, etc.).
So ostf should not be undefined but an empty object by default.

Closes-Bug: #1625115

Change-Id: I4615cde10acdc57cf7d2eb1575fd04c29240b625

commit_message:
Refactor events into own class

The eventing model needs to be updated to handle delayed events (and in
future needs more logic to handle resumes on target during LPM).  There
is going to be additional complexity in events.  This change set moves
it out into its own class so as not to keep growing the already long
driver.py file.

Change-Id: I1eadc930d9a55a5fb92f7cd6ffdd37965bb187b6
Partial-Bug: 1617746

commit_message:
Refactor events into own class

The eventing model needs to be updated to handle delayed events (and in
future needs more logic to handle resumes on target during LPM).  There
is going to be additional complexity in events.  This change set moves
it out into its own class so as not to keep growing the already long
driver.py file.

Change-Id: I1eadc930d9a55a5fb92f7cd6ffdd37965bb187b6
Partial-Bug: 1617746

1. The original wait_until_true function is deprecated.
We import it from the new module and make it local.

2. Unify the neutron operation timeout to 30 sec and the
command wait timeout to 5 sec.
We need to make it consistent among the tests.

3. Do not import eventlet as the base class is monkey-patched.

Change-Id: I7be216bafad59ba4447f1f75737bcd871bd261fa
'}]
commit_message:
Unify timeout of neutron operations in fullstack tests

1. The original wait_until_true function is deprecated.
We import it from the new module and make it local.

2. Unify the neutron operation timeout to 30 sec and the
command wait timeout to 5 sec.
We need to make it consistent among the tests.

3. Do not import eventlet as the base class is monkey-patched.

Change-Id: I7be216bafad59ba4447f1f75737bcd871bd261fa

subject: Added X-Forwarded-Proto headers for horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 11:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Added X-Forwarded-Proto headers for horizon

When enabling federated authentication with keystone, and then enabling websso
in horizon, the URL horizon constructs for the redirect is done internally, and
django needs to be able to know if it has to construct the url with http or
https. By setting this header at the haproxy level, horizon can make the correct
decision.

Change-Id: I0281fe1e5efa0d3f5983342dec70752246d9fca8
(cherry picked from commit b7fe58567704920a819128d43a8aa38807ebba9a)
'}]
commit_message:
Added X-Forwarded-Proto headers for horizon

When enabling federated authentication with keystone, and then enabling websso
in horizon, the URL horizon constructs for the redirect is done internally, and
django needs to be able to know if it has to construct the url with http or
https. By setting this header at the haproxy level, horizon can make the correct
decision.

Change-Id: I0281fe1e5efa0d3f5983342dec70752246d9fca8
(cherry picked from commit b7fe58567704920a819128d43a8aa38807ebba9a)

subject: [WIP] Drastically reduce list of actions allowed for nodes in maintenance
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}, {'_account_id': 20311, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ironic_ci@external.cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ironic_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 15:00:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/maintenance-actions-8c5a56b5a3f26135.yaml', 'ironic/common/states.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Drastically reduce list of actions allowed for nodes in maintenance

I've found that we allow cleaning to happen in maintenance. It's doomed to fail,
because we do not process heartbeats for such nodes. After more thinking I've
found that most of the actions do not make sense too, so this change bans them.
The only three left are "manage", "delete" and "abort".

Change-Id: Id57e5335aa47a0535c41e039b7612110f0d66a1f
Closes-Bug: #1621006
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Drastically reduce list of actions allowed for nodes in maintenance

I've found that we allow cleaning to happen in maintenance. It's doomed to fail,
because we do not process heartbeats for such nodes. After more thinking I've
found that most of the actions do not make sense too, so this change bans them.
The only three left are "manage", "delete" and "abort".

Change-Id: Id57e5335aa47a0535c41e039b7612110f0d66a1f
Closes-Bug: #1621006

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 00:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

dragonflow already uses PBR:- setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I060a1d6de972b01c19381f3fe1b5b88887eb04a7
Closes-Bug: #1608980
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

dragonflow already uses PBR:- setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I060a1d6de972b01c19381f3fe1b5b88887eb04a7
Closes-Bug: #1608980

subject: Fix logic in _is_valid_version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 03:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py'], 'message': "Fix logic in _is_valid_version

Currently the invalid version log is flooding, it is because
when the object version is identical, it considers it as
an invalid situation.

Actually, it doesn't matter if the version of new object is
identical to the version of old object. It is safe to ignore
this situation.

Change-Id: Ief477dbc577d9e3cb49d9dc702361a03af8bf4dd
Closes-Bug: #1635507
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic in _is_valid_version

Currently the invalid version log is flooding, it is because
when the object version is identical, it considers it as
an invalid situation.

Actually, it doesn't matter if the version of new object is
identical to the version of old object. It is safe to ignore
this situation.

Change-Id: Ief477dbc577d9e3cb49d9dc702361a03af8bf4dd
Closes-Bug: #1635507

commit_message:
make addresses aggregation in SGApp

The implement of '__sub__' and '__iter__' method in IPSet class are
different than what we expected, so the addresses match item  in
security group rule flows are not aggregated. This patch will convert
cidrs from IPSet type to list type when it's needed to fix this bug.
`

Closes-Bug: #1632984
Change-Id: I0f0cf8f9310a60e1947d891d9d00c7ebfb196f1b

subject: Start network connections after neutron forks workers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-20 03:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_mech_driver.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Start network connections after neutron forks workers

Initially, neutron-server will fork multiple workers for API and RPC.
It loads mechanism drivers and all the resources after mechanism
driver initialization will be forked including network connections.
It will make the external SDN system unstable, bring races and finally
make it unstable or dead.

The PluginWorker and process notification has been proposed in neutron
in liberty [1]. It provides several ways to deal with the multi-process
and multi-thread in mechansim driver.

In dragonflow, we need to make sure the northbound database connection
is initialized after the neutron workers are forked. So we use process
notification here to initialize the connections.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189391/

Change-Id: I076a831630e0f99f2ebbb39764aa43859b064bca
'}]
commit_message:
Start network connections after neutron forks workers

Initially, neutron-server will fork multiple workers for API and RPC.
It loads mechanism drivers and all the resources after mechanism
driver initialization will be forked including network connections.
It will make the external SDN system unstable, bring races and finally
make it unstable or dead.

The PluginWorker and process notification has been proposed in neutron
in liberty [1]. It provides several ways to deal with the multi-process
and multi-thread in mechansim driver.

In dragonflow, we need to make sure the northbound database connection
is initialized after the neutron workers are forked. So we use process
notification here to initialize the connections.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189391/

Change-Id: I076a831630e0f99f2ebbb39764aa43859b064bca

commit_message:
Calculate zaqar mongo from mongodb_node_ips

In order to make the zaqar service fully composable, the mongo ips need
to be calculated without assuming that mongo and zaqar are on the same
node.

commit_message:
Replace six iteration methods with standard ones

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iterXXX
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.XXX instead, as it
  will return iterators in PY3 as well.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

 [1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
 [2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Idc13a78f86a63015eb5141c3fe05cde19eb3f7c3
Co-Authored-By: Hanxi Liu <hanxi.liu@easystack.cn>

commit_message:
Handle label_id's DBReferenceError when creating label-rule

Currently, creating meter-label-rule with non-existent meter-label
is returned with 500 error, because there is no error handling for
foreign key constraint error from DB.
This patch adds error handling for the error from DB
and raises MeteringLabelNotFound error.

Change-Id: I05d6c70cfe1c54618c55cba435bc8e3301948738
Closes-Bug: #1608378

subject: Swift proxy performance fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 13:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth docu [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f
'}]
commit_message:
Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth docu [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f

subject: Make 'module' directives match filenames
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 14:42:50.000000000', 'files': ['elements/selinux/custom-policies/tripleo-selinux-rabbitmq.te', 'elements/selinux/custom-policies/tripleo-selinux-mariadb.te'], 'message': "Make 'module' directives match filenames

As of the following upstream commit to checkpolicy, compiling
policy modules with filenames which differ from the module
directive will fail:

https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/c6acfae4bc22586ad1dc259b0aad57fa6c5b43ef

This patch makes the policy filenames match the module directive
in the policy file, resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I5730bc51658bb886eacedd8af2c6251e1f8387f5
Closes-bug: 1636613
Signed-off-by: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3648c68a22b09bf0fc0604dba4f227ac3f3fbd75)
"}]
commit_message:
Make 'module' directives match filenames

As of the following upstream commit to checkpolicy, compiling
policy modules with filenames which differ from the module
directive will fail:

https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/c6acfae4bc22586ad1dc259b0aad57fa6c5b43ef

This patch makes the policy filenames match the module directive
in the policy file, resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I5730bc51658bb886eacedd8af2c6251e1f8387f5
Closes-bug: 1636613
Signed-off-by: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3648c68a22b09bf0fc0604dba4f227ac3f3fbd75)

subject: Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-30 17:16:14.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input

heat_stack_user role definitely does not have
enough permission to manage a heat stack and can't
be used in tempest, this is an internal role for heat.

We should use the same role for heat_stack_owner as
for a regular user.

This change also adds the role set for the regular users.
This role set also should enable volume backup usage,
so the swiftoperator role will be used.

Wouldn't be bad idea to rename the swiftoperator role
to something like 'user',
but it is out of scope for this change.

See also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1314725
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383369

Change-Id: If487dab0dc1d187ef0bacb9dbeae1186260ec975
(cherry picked from commit 435a500346bc9a1a0bffc4f2f8695e0919251664)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input

heat_stack_user role definitely does not have
enough permission to manage a heat stack and can't
be used in tempest, this is an internal role for heat.

We should use the same role for heat_stack_owner as
for a regular user.

This change also adds the role set for the regular users.
This role set also should enable volume backup usage,
so the swiftoperator role will be used.

Wouldn't be bad idea to rename the swiftoperator role
to something like 'user',
but it is out of scope for this change.

See also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1314725
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383369

Change-Id: If487dab0dc1d187ef0bacb9dbeae1186260ec975
(cherry picked from commit 435a500346bc9a1a0bffc4f2f8695e0919251664)

subject: Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA

In some cases, for instance, when updating from a non-SSL setup in
HAProxy to an SSL setup, we don't reload haproxy's configuration.
This is problematic since we need HAProxy to serve the certificates
and the new endpoints.

This forces the reload when puppet notices changes.

Change-Id: Ie1dd809e6beef33fadad48de55e488219fb7d686
Closes-Bug: #1636921
"}]
commit_message:
Reload haproxy if any configuration changes on HA

In some cases, for instance, when updating from a non-SSL setup in
HAProxy to an SSL setup, we don't reload haproxy's configuration.
This is problematic since we need HAProxy to serve the certificates
and the new endpoints.

This forces the reload when puppet notices changes.

Change-Id: Ie1dd809e6beef33fadad48de55e488219fb7d686
Closes-Bug: #1636921

Using sqlite is legacy and is no longer recommended. It won't work with the planned
HA architecture as well. This change switched to a new MySQL database.

Note that this has a big upgrade impact: introspection information will no longer
be available. I'm not sure how to deal with it, but it won't break too much,
assuming that users don't run introspection right during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I5f029139867ff3e7eb3d140f72e452dc7412ecdc
Depends-On: Ib4d3548e76a9314592d8b66707df1987d7cfc5b9
"}]
commit_message:
Switch ironic-inspector to mysql

Using sqlite is legacy and is no longer recommended. It won't work with the planned
HA architecture as well. This change switched to a new MySQL database.

Note that this has a big upgrade impact: introspection information will no longer
be available. I'm not sure how to deal with it, but it won't break too much,
assuming that users don't run introspection right during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I5f029139867ff3e7eb3d140f72e452dc7412ecdc
Depends-On: Ib4d3548e76a9314592d8b66707df1987d7cfc5b9

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-10-19 14:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/aodh/api.pp', 'manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Enable TLS in the internal network for aodh

This optionally enables TLS for aodh in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the aodh
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I50ef0c8fbecb19d6597a28290daa61a91f3b13fc
'}]
commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for aodh

This optionally enables TLS for aodh in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the aodh
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I50ef0c8fbecb19d6597a28290daa61a91f3b13fc

subject: Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 11:34:13.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/swift-proxy.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering

The Ceilometer middleware is in the wrong place; actually any middleware
should be deployed after catch_errors to catch any errors that would
otherwise crash the proxy service. Additionally the ceilometer
middleware should be deployed after any authentication middleware.

Closes-Bug: 1637471
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I710ff2f51271a78582fa502e7eecfa687800c664
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift proxy pipeline ordering

The Ceilometer middleware is in the wrong place; actually any middleware
should be deployed after catch_errors to catch any errors that would
otherwise crash the proxy service. Additionally the ceilometer
middleware should be deployed after any authentication middleware.

Closes-Bug: 1637471
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I710ff2f51271a78582fa502e7eecfa687800c664

commit_message:
Make ceilometer sample interval configurable

This could already be configured via the ceilometer_pipeline_yaml_overrides
in theory, but in practice this is very unpractical as one would have to
override the whole sources configuration. Only overriding one key in a
list of dicts is not possible.

Change-Id: Ieb5569982f080446295cecc33fb70c6b5d1cb9d6

commit_message:
Send instructions to workers to upload metadata

Upload file metadata into a separate container where the write
prefix doesn't include the LOG_PATH allowing us to store all the
metadata at the root level (as a hash of the LOG_PATH in the files
container).

Change-Id: I7fd2b3b7a86473431377885461375e118e64e8e4
Depends-On: I1a8a3a94b32ed754b95cf194f43efb9f73d84415

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-25 06:09:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_create_server.py'], 'message': 'Merge similar code in test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk

In test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk, two functions
(create_flavor_with_extra_specs/create_flavor_without_extra_specs)
are very similar and can be merged in one function.
Besides, "ephemeral" is not "extra_specs" of flavor, so

commit_message:
Merge similar code in test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk

In test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk, two functions
(create_flavor_with_extra_specs/create_flavor_without_extra_specs)
are very similar and can be merged in one function.
Besides, "ephemeral" is not "extra_specs" of flavor, so
function name and comments should also be modified.

commit_message:
Fetch MAC address only for eth0

With the new cirros image, there may be a bond0 interface, which will be
added to the list of ethernet MAC addresses, and as a result cause
failing tests. Instead explicitly call for the address of eth0 only.

Change-Id: I84e8d46ca66902e3e27384f8eb2727537bd048d6

Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

subject: enhance DHCP with improved transaction
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-19 07:03:35.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_commands.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_ovn_db_resources.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': 'enhance DHCP with improved transaction

Based on improved neutron ovsdb transaction, we can put two ovsdb commands
into to one transaction, when they have dependency on data structure.
Like, before we set port dhcp options for a port, or create a port with port
dhcp options, we need to insert the port dhcp options first, and get the
inserted UUID. And currently, we do these by separated transactions.

Separated transactions make orphan row can happen, and to clean orphan rows
related to ports left behind, we do full table scan to locate them, lose in
performance.

Since the patch will fix the orphan DHCP_Options row issue,
DelLSwitchPortCommand will be also enhanced to remove port dhcp options
referred by port within the same transaction.

Depends-on: I1781794958af1483dabc0f5d17f2df6fea828564
Closes-bug: #1626812
Closes-bug: #1626828
Change-Id: Id078d57fe84e1af8db061ae6b812f162fed02dcd
'}]
commit_message:
enhance DHCP with improved transaction

Based on improved neutron ovsdb transaction, we can put two ovsdb commands
into to one transaction, when they have dependency on data structure.
Like, before we set port dhcp options for a port, or create a port with port
dhcp options, we need to insert the port dhcp options first, and get the
inserted UUID. And currently, we do these by separated transactions.

Separated transactions make orphan row can happen, and to clean orphan rows
related to ports left behind, we do full table scan to locate them, lose in
performance.

Since the patch will fix the orphan DHCP_Options row issue,
DelLSwitchPortCommand will be also enhanced to remove port dhcp options
referred by port within the same transaction.

Depends-on: I1781794958af1483dabc0f5d17f2df6fea828564
Closes-bug: #1626812
Closes-bug: #1626828
Change-Id: Id078d57fe84e1af8db061ae6b812f162fed02dcd

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-10-19 14:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/ceilometer/api.pp'], 'message': 'Enable TLS in the internal network for ceilometer

This optionally enables TLS for aodh in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the ceilometer
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Ib5609f77a31b17ed12baea419ecfab5d5f676496
'}]
commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for ceilometer

This optionally enables TLS for aodh in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the ceilometer
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Ib5609f77a31b17ed12baea419ecfab5d5f676496

commit_message:
Move incomplete OpenStack-Ansible projects to release:none

The following OpenStack-Ansible repositories that are currently listed
as release:cycle-trailing are not ready for a release cycle, and are
currently in early development or non-functional:

os_barbican
os_cloudkitty
os_designate
os_monasca
os_watcher
os_zaqar

This PR moves these repositories to release:none. These will be moved to
follow a release once these repositories are functional and ready.

Change-Id: I1996302e78a6bda934e67b13e65941e500ecb5e2

commit_message:
Expose add botton when text_list is empty

The issue is that when a text_list is empty
there is nothing to render including 'add'
and 'delete' buttons. We should provide the
possibility to add items when the list is empty.

Change-Id: I991ec3a885a6462f4a8afd7f96591fd7ec82a0b4
Closes-Bug: #1613614

commit_message:
exclude existing stable branches for new gate job

The newly created gate job
gate-trove-buildimage-{datastore}{job-suffix} depends on things in the
trove tree that have just been added in master (which will become
ocata). Therefore these tests should be excluded for existing stable
branches.

Change-Id: I8d1009a985e961a00808dd711511a1857d7b7e5f

subject: Add experimental-zuul-pep8-ubuntu-xenial job
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-30 21:13:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add experimental-zuul-pep8-ubuntu-xenial job

In an effort to make our bindep dependencies better, we want to
experiment having the pep8 jobs not use our wheel mirrors.  This
ensures that projects are able to be build properly if our wheel
mirror is down or a new python dependency is released by has not been
build by our wheel-build job.

This is patch will be reverted once we confirmed the job works as
expected.

Change-Id: I03be650963e8f0e5630ad658882b0ce6692c4b45
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add experimental-zuul-pep8-ubuntu-xenial job

In an effort to make our bindep dependencies better, we want to
experiment having the pep8 jobs not use our wheel mirrors.  This
ensures that projects are able to be build properly if our wheel
mirror is down or a new python dependency is released by has not been
build by our wheel-build job.

This is patch will be reverted once we confirmed the job works as
expected.

Change-Id: I03be650963e8f0e5630ad658882b0ce6692c4b45
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix issues with neutron-fwaas Grafana dashboard

This change accomplishes a number of things to fix issues with the
neutron-fwaas Grafana dashboard and keep it up to date.

- It fixes a few issues with statistics in the FWaaS dashboard that
  caused stats not to render.
- It organizes the panels into rows for readability.
- It adjusts a couple job names that were altered in
  https://review.openstack.org/389320 for voting.

Change-Id: I362933bca5484d34afac24e1d5875f9738ca91b7
Depends-On: I845bbdb000fff120b358eea6d4de2f93bc0bfd0b

subject: Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/checkers.py'], 'message': "Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat

Commit Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2 introduces change
according which Swift resourses shouldn't been created if Ceph is
enabled. Swift user in Keystone database also shouldn't been created
in this case. That's why decreasing of keystone_user count is needed
in check_oswl_stat method.

Change-Id: I00ab09191ce6919d74a16a76249719f8cfb01800
Closes-Bug: #1634810
"}]
commit_message:
Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat

Commit Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2 introduces change
according which Swift resourses shouldn't been created if Ceph is
enabled. Swift user in Keystone database also shouldn't been created
in this case. That's why decreasing of keystone_user count is needed
in check_oswl_stat method.

Change-Id: I00ab09191ce6919d74a16a76249719f8cfb01800
Closes-Bug: #1634810

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-27 14:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/lcm/transaction_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.

Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed
to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in
deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but
upstream repositories have much older version.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051

Closes-Bug: #1602365
Change-Id: I0676de8f74cf4e0d248e0a074b58960bf86b7fbd
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.

Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed
to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in
deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but
upstream repositories have much older version.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051

Closes-Bug: #1602365
Change-Id: I0676de8f74cf4e0d248e0a074b58960bf86b7fbd

commit_message:
Temporarily ignore tests in python-solumclient with Python 2.7.5

We have an issue with Python 2.7.5 and two of the tests in
python-solumclient (http://bugs.python.org/issue18015). While a
patch is delivered to python in CentOS, let's just ignore test
results if they fail.

Change-Id: I68938680b442cc6adc5e95b4ef93969204c66f74

subject: With assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}, {'_account_id': 22220, 'name': 'Anindita Das', 'email': 'anindita.das@utexas.edu', 'username': 'anudas'}, {'_account_id': 22574, 'name': 'lilintan', 'email': 'lintan.li@easystack.cn', 'username': 'lilintan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-09-11 02:09:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/functional/core/test_cli_formatter.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': "With assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In order to unified specification,so we can use assertEqual
instead of assertDictEqual.OpenStack now has dropped support
for python 2.6 and lower. So we don't need to define an
assertDictEqual() for python lower than 2.7.

Further, assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dicts
comparation, just the same as assertDictEqual() in unittest2.
So we don't need to call assertDictEqual() for dicts any more.

Change-Id: I7dc0fc2006f0894615b9b13d2727c00c2dced2ed
"}]
commit_message:
With assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In order to unified specification,so we can use assertEqual
instead of assertDictEqual.OpenStack now has dropped support
for python 2.6 and lower. So we don't need to define an
assertDictEqual() for python lower than 2.7.

Further, assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dicts
comparation, just the same as assertDictEqual() in unittest2.
So we don't need to call assertDictEqual() for dicts any more.

Change-Id: I7dc0fc2006f0894615b9b13d2727c00c2dced2ed

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 04:20:54.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: If2ca9333319fd78a53c73ab313411ed2f17b07f2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: If2ca9333319fd78a53c73ab313411ed2f17b07f2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 13:23:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder_backends/lvm'], 'message': 'cinder_backends/lvm: use VOLUME_CLEAR instead of SECURE_DELETE

Although SECURE_DELETE was correctly handled in lib/cinder, that
config flag was just completely ignored by lib/cinder_backend/lvm.
But the `volume_clear` config option must be set on a per backend
basis, which means that without this patch CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR
has no effect(ignored) for the LVM backend.

Change-Id: I5e8f389cfc5fb0130f18f6eaf2f1d6045c3d46ef
'}]
commit_message:
cinder_backends/lvm: use VOLUME_CLEAR instead of SECURE_DELETE

Although SECURE_DELETE was correctly handled in lib/cinder, that
config flag was just completely ignored by lib/cinder_backend/lvm.
But the `volume_clear` config option must be set on a per backend
basis, which means that without this patch CINDER_VOLUME_CLEAR
has no effect(ignored) for the LVM backend.

Change-Id: I5e8f389cfc5fb0130f18f6eaf2f1d6045c3d46ef

commit_message:
Zfssaiscsi: Implement replication v2

This patch implements managed replication v2
for the zfssaiscsi driver.

Currently only async and managed is supported.
cinder.conf should have the replication_device
property as shown.

[zfssa1]
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.zfssa.zfssaiscsi.ZFSSAISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = zfssa1
san_ip = 10.10.10.10
san_login = user
san_password = pass
zfssa_pool = pool1
zfssa_project = proj1
zfssa_initiator_group = default
zfssa_target_portal = 10.10.10.10:3260
zfssa_target_interfaces = e1000
replication_device = managed_backend_name:ubuntu@zfssa2#zfssa2
                     target_ip:11.11.11.11
                     login:user
                     password:pass
                     target_pool:pool2
                     target_project:proj2
                     target_replication_ip:11.11.11.11
                     label:zfssa2-name
                     frequency:day

[zfssa2]
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.zfssa.zfssaiscsi.ZFSSAISCSIDriver
volume_backend_name = zfssa2
san_ip = 11.11.11.11
san_login = user
san_password = pass
zfssa_pool = pool2
zfssa_project = proj2
zfssa_initiator_group = default
zfssa_target_portal = 11.11.11.11:3260
zfssa_target_interfaces = e1000
replication_device = managed_backend_name:ubuntu@zfssa2#zfssa2
                     target_ip:10.10.10.10
                     login:user
                     password:pass
                     target_pool:pool1
                     target_project:proj1
                     target_replication_ip:10.10.10.10
                     label:zfssa1-name
                     frequency:hour

Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-iscsi-driver-replication
DocImpact

Change-Id: I24e9ed5d93f665ebf24c4a281993cc6335c6cc8d
